newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU hikes malt export refund to 35 Ecus.
newsitem.headline: EU hikes malt export refund to 35 Ecus.

text.p: The European Union on Thursday raised its standing refund for malt exports to 35 Ecus per tonne from a previous level of 32.50 Ecus, EU grain officials said.

The decision follows weeks of at-times heated debate between the European Commission and malt exporters but falls short of their demands for a refund 30 percent above the underlying export refund for barley.
The EU's cereals management committee, which took the decision at weekly grain talks in Brussels, also issued a little changed barley export refund of a maximum 31 Ecus per tonne.
Applying the maltsters demands to that level would imply a malt refund of 40.3 Ecus per tonne.

Officials said the European Commission remains sceptical about the need for a stronger increase because maltsters have already taken up over a tenth of their annual export capacity of two million tonnes at the original 32.5 Ecus per tonne level.
Latest malt export applications are around 250,000 tonnes.
Malt industry representatives were not immediately available to comment on Thursday's decisions. --Paris newsroom +331 4221 5146
